Job Title: Lead Software Engineer, Application Administrator, SIS

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
American Public Education, Inc. 

The Lead Software Engineer, Application Administrator, SIS is responsible for the administration and operations of the Student Information Systems platforms and associated applications such as Anthology, CAMS, Jenzabar, or custom. She/he will serve as the primary technical authority and will lead and coordinate IT and Business resources for platform administration, deployments, troubleshooting, maintenance, and technical support activities. This position may analyze requirements, workflows, procedures, and automation improvements to existing and new application/systems to ensure high availability, proper function, and overall 24x7 application performance. The Lead Software Engineer, Application Administrator, SIS will lead and participate in application configuration, maintenance, enhancements, upgrades, updates, end-user training, and system-wide integrations. She/he will mentor and assist IT team members to ensure accurate and timely diagnosis, recovery, and permanent resolution of issues that impact platform availability, business processes, and document management. The individual in this role will partner with software engineering teams, IT operations teams, business analysts, and business leaders to identify, define, analyze and implement changes and enhancements that meet business requirements in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

The Lead Software Engineer, Application Administrator, SIS does not have any direct or indirect reports. This position reports directly to the Director, Software Engineering.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for the overall application administration, configuration, functionality, performance, and support of the SIS platforms and associated applications.Obtains understanding of the APEI application environments including the Finance, HR, SIS, LMS, integrations, data warehouse, and application interdependencies.Collaborate with IT and Technology Domains on development, operational, process, and application support needs.Will have a clear understanding of the various upstream/downstream dependencies, end to end business process & data flow of the applications supported.Troubleshoots and resolves complex application/system issues in a timely fashion and meet business priorities.Confers key business users involved to analyze current operational procedures, identify problems, and learn specific input and output requirements including forms of data input, methods to summarize data, formats, and reports.Provide consultation for technical best practices within the scope of SIS and associated applications needs.Stays abreast of new release capabilities, end of life solutions, etc.; proactively seek out issues before they are present.Receives, validates, tests, and documents monthly update packages.Reviews application/platform capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to support requested change/modification.Studies existing business processes of application/platform(s) to evaluate effectiveness and makes suggestions to improve production workflow as required.Prepares workflow, diagrams, support documentation to specify standard operating procedures to be performed.Participate in IT Change Management processes, including validating changes, upgrade, and other infrastructure changes to production environment.Submits requests and assists with upgrades and improvements for application/system performance.Assists Software, Data, & Support Engineers in resolution of incidents/problems related to application/systems. May lead and coordinate the work of others to develop, test, install, and modify programs.Develops and maintains system documentation to ensure operational efficiency.Responsible for updating required documentation & knowledgebase, maintain integrity of information, and timely update of tickets and applicable processes.Works with Software Engineering teams on 24/7 on-call rotation environment.Responsible for receiving, validating, testing, and documenting monthly update packages.Maintains appropriate user roles and permissions, access settings, etc. (user profiles, tool access, data visibility, and account management) in accordance with security policy.Assists IT teams on proposed solutions, functional & technical needs, automation, testing, documentation, and automation, including work effort estimates.Translates approved solutions into actionable deliverables, ensuring high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency.Coordinates and communicates upcoming environment refreshes and readiness.Obtains and disseminates platform and associated application metrics and KPIs.Participate in security audits as/when needed.Perform other duties as assigned.


Requirements:

Minimum of 10+ years of overall IT experience, 3+ years of hands-on experience providing application administration, support, and maintenance of Anthology, CAMS, Jenzabar, and/or custom highly preferred.Ability to quickly digest information, understand the business objective, and prepare/takes actions.Displays strong responsibility, collaboration, and problem-solving abilities with a positive attitude.Extreme responsiveness with ability to work under pressure in critical situations maintaining a clear sense of urgency.Recognizes and identifies potential areas where existing methods, procedures, policies require change, or where new ones need to be developed.Experience with .NET technologies, ADO (Azure DevOps), and SDLC & SCM practices.Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, in a 24x7 environment; ability to work flexible hours and be on-call.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Familiarity with source control and source control practices (Git, Subversion, etc.).Leads organizational improvements and advances resources with new opportunitiesStrong business acumen and service orientationFlexibility in an ever-changing environmentAbility to plan and monitor resultsStrong initiative, analytical, and organizational skills with attention to detail.Willingness and ability to learn new skills. 


Education:

Bachelor's degree preferred


About Us:

Online, on campus and in the workplace, we provide higher education and training to our country’s heroes – military service members, veterans, nurses, government employees, and motivated professionals that want to make a difference. American Public Education, Inc. educates service-minded students, ranging from the military, public service, federal agencies, and nursing communities, through American Public University System (APUS), Hondros College of Nursing (HCON), Rasmussen University and Graduate School USA (GSUSA).

It is the policy of American Public Education, Inc. (APEI) to afford equal opportunity to all qualified persons. We treat all qualified individuals equally as to their recruitment, hiring, assignments, advancements, compensation, and all other terms and conditions of employment. American Public Education, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, or physical, mental, or sensory disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Colorado, California, Washington and NYC Pay Transparency Statement

If you are a resident of Colorado, California, Washington or New York City and this role is available remotely, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request. Please send an email to recruiting@apei.com

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
